question: 空き瓶
sourceMnemonic: A <kanji>sky</kanji> <kanji>bottle</kanji> is a bottle that has nothing but sky in it. It's an <vocabulary>empty bottle</vocabulary>.
sourceReadingMnemonic: The reading is a combination of kun'yomi and on'yomi readings. You learned this reading for <ja>空</ja> when you learned <ja>空き缶</ja>. If you can remember that, you can remember this too! Oh and sometimes you'll see this written <ja>空瓶</ja> without the kana too. And when that happens it can be read <ja>からびん</ja>! So if you learned it one way and not the other, don't worry, we'll take both here. Just know that seeing it as <ja>空き瓶</ja> (and pronouncing it <ja>あきびん</ja>) is way more common.
